name: Dropped
description:
Play as Splash the water droplet, find friends and make your way back home where all water drops are one!

Controls:

Keyboard:

  • W / UP ARROW / SPACE/ SHIFT = Jump
  • A / LEFT ARROW = Move Left
  • D / RIGHT ARROW = Move Right
  • ESCAPE /  1 + 2 = Quit
  • ALT + ENTER = Toggle Fullscreen
  • 2 + 4 = New Game

All other alphabetic keys on a US keyboard will also cause jumping.

Note: that the DOWN ARROW does not jump due to weird keyboards with small arrow keys.

Controller (Only tested with Xbox360):

  • A / B / X / Y = Jump
  • Joystick Left = Move Left
  • Joystick Right = Move Right
  • Exit the game with the keyboard
  • Back/Select Button = New Game

Dropped is 57 levels, and is fairly challenging in the later levels, but can be completed in roughly 2 hours. Thus, Dropped lacks saves to make it a more challenging experience. Dropped will also display your total deaths and play time when you complete a full run. Dropped was an experiment within five areas:

  1. What is a game like with no horizontal collisions?
  2. What can be achieved as a programmer doing pixel art?
  3. Are single screen levels even fun anymore?
  4. Can I make more fun levels? 
  5. Can I learn GameMaker Studio 1.4 in a day?

Note that this is a new release to itch, but I built it and released it on my personal website in late 2016.
